description: Modifies the specified transit gateway. When you modify a transit gateway, the modified options are applied to new transit gateway attachments only. Your existing transit gateway attachments are not modified.

parameters.name: TransitGatewayId
parameters.description: The ID of the transit gateway.

parameters.name: Options
parameters.description: The options to modify. AddTransitGatewayCidrBlocks (list) --- Adds IPv4 or IPv6 CIDR blocks for the transit gateway. Must be a size /24 CIDR block or larger for IPv4, or a size /64 CIDR block or larger for IPv6. (string) --- RemoveTransitGatewayCidrBlocks (list) --- Removes CIDR blocks for the transit gateway. (string) --- VpnEcmpSupport (string) --- Enable or disable Equal Cost Multipath Protocol support. DnsSupport (string) --- Enable or disable DNS support. SecurityGroupReferencingSupport (string) --- Enables you to reference a security group across VPCs attached to a transit gateway to simplify security group management. This option is disabled by default. For more information about security group referencing, see Security group referencing in the Amazon Web Services Transit Gateways Guide. AutoAcceptSharedAttachments (string) --- Enable or disable automatic acceptance of attachment requests. DefaultRouteTableAssociation (string) --- Enable or disable automatic association with the default association route table. AssociationDefaultRouteTableId (string) --- The ID of the default association route table. DefaultRouteTablePropagation (string) --- Enable or disable automatic propagation of routes to the default propagation route table. PropagationDefaultRouteTableId (string) --- The ID of the default propagation route table. AmazonSideAsn (integer) --- A private Autonomous System Number (ASN) for the Amazon side of a BGP session. The range is 64512 to 65534 for 16-bit ASNs and 4200000000 to 4294967294 for 32-bit ASNs. The modify ASN operation is not allowed on a transit gateway if it has the following attachments: Dynamic VPN Static VPN Direct Connect Gateway Connect You must first delete all transit gateway attachments configured prior to modifying the ASN on the transit gateway.

nested_params.name: AddTransitGatewayCidrBlocks
nested_params.description: Adds IPv4 or IPv6 CIDR blocks for the transit gateway. Must be a size /24 CIDR block or larger for IPv4, or a size /64 CIDR block or larger for IPv6.

nested_params.name: RemoveTransitGatewayCidrBlocks
nested_params.description: Removes CIDR blocks for the transit gateway.

nested_params.name: SecurityGroupReferencingSupport
nested_params.description: Enables you to reference a security group across VPCs attached to a transit gateway to simplify security group management. This option is disabled by default. For more information about security group referencing, see Security group referencing in the Amazon Web Services Transit Gateways Guide.

nested_items.name: TransitGateway
nested_items.description: Information about the transit gateway.

nested_items.description: The ID of the transit gateway.

nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the transit gateway.

nested_items.description: The description of the transit gateway.

nested_items.description: The creation time.

nested_items.description: A private Autonomous System Number (ASN) for the Amazon side of a BGP session. The range is 64512 to 65534 for 16-bit ASNs and 4200000000 to 4294967294 for 32-bit ASNs.

nested_items.name: TransitGatewayCidrBlocks

(string) ---

nested_items.name: AutoAcceptSharedAttachments
nested_items.description: Indicates whether attachment requests are automatically accepted.

nested_items.name: DefaultRouteTableAssociation
nested_items.description: Indicates whether resource attachments are automatically associated with the default association route table. Enabled by default. If defaultRouteTableAssociation is set to enable, Amazon Web Services Transit Gateway will create the default transit gateway route table.

nested_items.name: AssociationDefaultRouteTableId
nested_items.description: The ID of the default association route table.

nested_items.name: DefaultRouteTablePropagation
nested_items.description: Indicates whether resource attachments automatically propagate routes to the default propagation route table. Enabled by default. If defaultRouteTablePropagation is set to enable, Amazon Web Services Transit Gateway will create the default transit gateway route table.

nested_items.name: PropagationDefaultRouteTableId
nested_items.description: The ID of the default propagation route table.

nested_items.name: VpnEcmpSupport
nested_items.description: Indicates whether Equal Cost Multipath Protocol support is enabled.

nested_items.name: DnsSupport
nested_items.description: Indicates whether DNS support is enabled.

nested_items.name: SecurityGroupReferencingSupport
nested_items.description: Enables you to reference a security group across VPCs attached to a transit gateway to simplify security group management.

nested_items.name: MulticastSupport
nested_items.description: Indicates whether multicast is enabled on the transit gateway.

nested_items.name: Tags
nested_items.description: The tags for the transit gateway.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: The key of the tag.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The value of the tag.
